item.title: Heroku Killers
item.description: Source Heroku killed free tier Alternatives for running a docker image Railway.app Render.com Fly.io Alternatives for hosting a website Vercel Netlify Github Pages Render.

item.title: Redis Explained
item.description: Source Redis (REmote DIctionary Service) - key-value db In-memory database, backup to disk Use as cache in the past Like Memcached, but more features Many architecture configurations supported Single instance - Main db only HA (High Availability) - Has replications to secondary db Sentinel - Has Sentinel(s) to monitor main & secondaries Cluster - Horizontal scaling, gossipping nodes Many persistence models No persistence RDB (Redis Database) file - Save db as file snapshot, faster than AOF AOF (Append Only File) - Log write operations to be replayed again, more durable that RDB Flushes to disk with fsync when possible RDB + AOF - More durable but slower Forking - OS creates process copy, but shares memory with copy-on-write technique Redis uses this technique to persist the data performantly.

item.title: How I Focus While Coding
item.description: Source Many people recommend time boxing methods like Pomodoro Technique: 25m work followed by 5m break. But it doesn’t work well with coding (at least for him), where your train of thoughts or flow state will be lost every 25 minutes and you have to start all over again.

item.title: Choose Boring Technology
item.description: src: https://boringtechnology.club Summary The answer of “How do you make devs happy?” for many developers: Chase shiny objects Imagine you have “Innovation Tokens” to use for building new things, and you have 3 tokens to use.

item.title: How to learn hard things in tech
item.description: Source Summary Don’t know where to start on new/hard tech? Build. Find the example, use it as the baseline for building Modify, see results If it doesn’t work, read or watch someone explain it Repeat Force yourself to do 1.

item.title: Gary's Internet Typing Guide
item.description: src: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1D9hzmKMCWzbqIBqpA4j02a2XjuhJbILimBMAFM2Deis/edit How to touch type Keybr.com for starters, then Monkeytype.com Practice 8 fingers typing Never look keyboard (especially on 26 letters, spacebar, backspace) Understanding the role of repetition
